title: Project Coordinator
description:
As a leader in our industry PB tec develops innovative and advanced horticultural solutions in the field of electrical engineering, lighting, water engineering and automation.

Complete solutions to contribute to a high-quality water purification and food supply for everyone. Technology is what we do, innovation is what we live for. Innovative partner in the field of horticultural solutions.

PB tec is currently seeking a Project Coordinator for international service and construction.

Superior interpersonal, presentation and writing skills are essential in working effectively with clients and project team members. Applying your technical and organizational skills to the project management knowledge areas of project integration, scope, schedule, cost, quality, HR, communications, risk and procurement will be key components of your professional development.

Scope:

Work as part of a team to meet deadlines and produce high-quality deliverables.

Assist the Project Manager with day-to-day project management activities.

Facilitate communication with teams, sub-consultants and the client.

Work closely with the project team to maintain a current and accurate understanding of project status, issues and changes.

Gather data to produce and distribute detailed and summary project management reports capturing general project, schedule, cost and risk information.

Assist in developing detailed project schedules and tracking project costs.

Ensure project deliverables are in accordance with the applicable project requirements.

Follow document control processes and procedures established for project functions including document tracking, meeting minutes, RFIs, submittals, change logs and other communication tools. Fulfill the Document Control function on projects.

Attend/lead project meetings and maintain meeting minutes.

Adhere to client standards and internal procedures.

Provide general team project and office support as required.

Essential function:

Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and assignments.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to solve problems.

Strong analytical skills.

Detail-oriented and resourceful.

Demonstrates exceptional interpersonal skills.

Able to successfully work both collaboratively and independently.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office.

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Positive attitude with strong relationship building skills.

Experience with standard project management methodologies and tools such as SharePoint, etc. preferred

Ability to travel for project related work is required

Education And Experience:

Technical degree/diploma/certificate or equivalent in a related field: or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

1-3 years related experience in a related role in the electrical, mechanical, or construction industry

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $41,954.00-$81,348.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • divers (preferred)

title: Architectural Technologist
description:
Who We Are:

Murray's is a full-service horticultural and landscape company offering renowned expertise in landscape design, construction, and maintenance.

Located in beautiful Portugal Cove-St. Philips, NL, Murray’s has won numerous landscape awards, including 4 LNLHA Awards of Landscape Excellence in design and construction categories for 2022.

Our team values collaboration and creativity and is passionate about creating functional and beautiful spaces that complement the unique landscape and climate of Newfoundland and Labrador.

Our professionalism and attention to detail helps us create lasting landscapes and impressions that have made us industry leaders throughout the province and Atlantic Canada.

We believe there is a special art in crafting nature.

For over 40 years, we have worked collaboratively with our clients through our garden centre, floral shop, and landscape company in Portugal Cove-St. Philips to ensure that their properties and living spaces accentuate the beauty that nature intended.

Why Work With Us?

We offer:

  • A stimulating and motivating work environment
  • A diversity of projects.
  • Flexible work schedule in winter months
  • Support for professional development and continuing education in work related fields
  • Benefits and competitive compensation
  • Professional, experienced, & knowledgeable managers
  • Company team events (BBQs, Axe Throwing, Thanksgiving & Christmas parties)
  • Opportunities to grow and develop your career in the green industry.

Job Description:

Murray’s is seeking a Landscape / Architectural Technologist with three (3) or more years of work experience to join our team.

The position is a 3-month contract with possible extension to full time at the end of the 3 month period.

The successful candidate will preferably have landscape design and drafting experience and experience in preparation of architectural designs and drawings using AutoCAD and ensuring that design drawings conform to specifications provided. The role will create and coordinate landscape designs for large residential, municipal and commercial project design and construction, using knowledge of construction process and applicable building codes.

Responsibilities will also include coordinating development permits, daily communication directly with landscape architects, designers and horticulturists.

In addition, the successful candidate will work directly with our construction team to create beautiful landscapes throughout the Province of Newfoundland and Labrador.

This position is a great opportunity for a creative individual with interests in the outdoors and landscape design, horticulture, construction and project management to join our growing design-build team.

The individual must have good visual communication skills and the ability to work individually and collectively in a team environment.

Responsibilities

  • Meetings with clients (residential, commercial and public projects.)
  • Prepare conceptual designs and graphics for presentation purposes.
  • Prepare construction quotations based off designs and site visits.
  • Conduct pre-design site visits and record technical information.
  • Develop detailed designs and construction documents.
  • Prepare cost estimates.
  • Internal coordination with design team and construction staff.
  • Attend meetings and coordinate work with construction crews, clients, consultants, subconsultants and subcontractors
  • Field layout, reviews and inspections of work.
  • Assist landscape architects with contract administration
  • Assist in the preparation of proposals and other marketing materials

Qualifications

  • University degree in Landscape Architecture / Diploma in Landscape Design or Architectural Technology. Architectural and Civil technologist with related experience are encouraged to apply.
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD, AutoCAD Civil 3D, Sketch-Up, Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative

Cloud and other graphics software

  • 3-5 years of office experience in landscape design or similar design disciplines (civil,

architecture)

  • Construction knowledge and contract administration experience
  • Excellent oral, written and graphic communication skills
  • Plant knowledge, as asset.
  • Good file management and organizational skills
  • Ability to work in a team and collaborative environment
  • Experience in preparing contract documents and working drawings
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Membership or ability to become a member with the APALA and/or CSLA is an asset but not required.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $30,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Landscape Design: 3 years (preferred)
  • AutoCAD: 3 years (preferred)

title: Office Manager/receptionist/bookkeeper
description:
Company description

Talbot Mackenzie & Associates is a consulting firm located in Victoria BC that specializes in arboriculture and horticultural issues. Our mandate is to provide honest unbiased opinions based on education and experience for all of our clients’ arboriculture and horticultural needs. Our consultants are ISA certified and Certified Tree risk assessors and regularly attend workshops and training seminars to keep abreast of the latest advances in our profession.

We have completed arborist services for public and private clients throughout the Greater Victoria region, including: Most of the Regional Municipalities, Capital Regional District Parks and Water Services, The Province of BC, Government of Canada and major Architectural, Engineering and General Contracting companies in the region.

Job description

Office manager/receptionist/bookkeeper

We are looking for someone to join our growing team and assist in our day-to-day operations. Duties will include:

· Answering incoming calls, taking messages, and re-directing calls and emails as required.

· Assists with administration tasks including filing, direct mail, and communications.

· Invoicing clients and assisting in account receivable/payables and some bookkeeping duties.

· Helping to keep track of workload and organizing projects.

· Proof reading completed reports.

· Review RFP documents and help to compile proposals.

· Maintain an organized filing system of paper and electronic documents

Skill should include:

Looking for a detail orientated person who has strong organizational skills

Able to work both in a team environment and independently when necessary.

Proficient with accounting software (Sage) and general computer expertise (Microsoft Office, Word, Excel)

Proficiency in written and spoken English

Additional skills that would be beneficial:

An interest in trees, the environment and the urban forest.

Willingness to expand into other roles in the company If needed.

Familiarity with Autocad or willing to learn.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$27.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
During Covid - 19, we are working remotely when possible and offering flexible work schedules.

Kindret Landscaping Group is a Winnipeg-based Landscape Design/Build & Maintenance company. We are an award-winning, team-oriented, full-spectrum landscaping operation. Our services include commercial & residential landscape design and construction, year-round maintenance, and snow removal in the winter months.

As a result of continued growth and demand, we are currently seeking the services of an experienced full-time Landscape Estimator to join our team. The position available is full-time, year-round.

· Review, understand and evaluate tender documents and drawings.

title: Process Engineering Manager
description:
Are you a highly methodical, analytical, self-motivated individual with great technical and people skills, and who’s project management and communication skills would rival the best engineers in existence? If so, we would love to hear from you!

At GoodLeaf Farms we are focused on producing local and ultra-fresh greens, sustainably, 365 days a year. We do this in an innovative way using the evolving technology of vertical farming. We have an R&D facility in Bible Hill, NS, Canada’s first and largest commercial scale vertical farm in Guelph, ON and we are rapidly growing to other regions across Canada, the United States, and globally.

GoodLeaf Farms has a strategic partnership with and investment from McCain Foods Limited, the world’s largest manufacturer of frozen potato products and a global leader in appetizers and snacks. This partnership enables the successful candidate to experience rapid innovation, entrepreneurship, and to be part of a new revolution in controlled environment agriculture, a new technology to grow fresh and nutritious leafy greens of the highest quality and flavour, in an environmentally sustainable way, 365 days per year!

Reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Process Engineering Manager leads & executes the development of specifications and design concepts for the GoodLeaf production platform. This can encompass Seeding, Germination, Growing, Harvesting, Packaging, and Support Systems (irrigation water treatment, climate controls and LED lighting). This role works closely with internal stakeholders to design new farming systems, to improve existing processes, to develop and implement R&D initiatives and to evaluate new technologies.

In accordance with our mandatory vaccination policy, we will only interview applicants who have been fully vaccinated, or who are unable to vaccinate due to valid medical or religious reasons, and who are willing to work in-office when required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Technical ownership for segments of the GoodLeaf production platform, by becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the design and operational intent of the various farming facilities, platforms, systems, and optimization

  • Develop and deploy new farm designs based on adapting the production platform to meet operational and commercial requirements

  • Support Operations in the creation and maintenance of production operating procedures

  • Assess the value-added and appropriate use of human effort versus automation in all systems

  • Manage the approval of manufacturing drawings, inspection of equipment, and installation leading up to commissioning

  • Assist in Commission-Qualify-Verify (CQV) activities for new farm facilities and systems

  • Assist in maintaining technology and process standardization across the GoodLeaf farm network

  • Create and maintain relationships with consultants, suppliers, developers

  • Increase and develop internal knowledge with respect to vertical farming technologies (automation, climate control, irrigation, harvesting, packaging), manufacturing technologies and practices, data management/analysis

  • Actively improve technical knowledge in the controlled environment agriculture (CEA) industry

  • Lead teams of internal and external stakeholders in reviewing existing and future designs

  • Directly supervise technical teams as GoodLeaf grows

Qualifications, Education Requirements, and Preferred Skills

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Industrial, Systems, Manufacturing) is required

  • A minimum of 10 years’ experience in technical roles encompassing process design, equipment procurement and installation, with at least 4 years’ leadership experience in a technical or operational role

  • Legally able to work in Canada and be able to cross international borders without legal assistance

  • Mastery of 2D and 3D CAD (AutoCAD, Inventor, or Solidworks)

  • Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint) and Google products

  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English (French is an asset)

  • Experience in managing fast track design/build projects or multiple significant upgrade projects

  • Flexibility and willingness to travel to facilities across the country as required

  • Familiarity with the major technical systems of an indoor farm (irrigation, lighting, HVAC, nutrients & food safety)

  • Experience in an engineering or process design role within the CEA industry

  • Experience within a food manufacturing or a horticultural environment

We pride ourselves in having a great team, who understands the importance of locally produced food and growing a great product. Is that you? We’d love to have you join our growing team!

Want to join us? Apply now using the form below, or email your application to the attention of Doris Yip, Human Resources Director at careers@goodleaffarms.com

title: Process Engineering Manager
description:
Are you a highly methodical, analytical, self-motivated individual with great technical and people skills, and who’s project management and communication skills would rival the best engineers in existence? If so, we would love to hear from you!

At GoodLeaf Farms we are focused on producing local and ultra-fresh greens, sustainably, 365 days a year. We do this in an innovative way using the evolving technology of vertical farming. We have an R&D facility in Bible Hill, NS, Canada’s first and largest commercial scale vertical farm in Guelph, ON and we are rapidly growing to other regions across Canada, the United States, and globally.

GoodLeaf Farms has a strategic partnership with and investment from McCain Foods Limited, the world’s largest manufacturer of frozen potato products and a global leader in appetizers and snacks. This partnership enables the successful candidate to experience rapid innovation, entrepreneurship, and to be part of a new revolution in controlled environment agriculture, a new technology to grow fresh and nutritious leafy greens of the highest quality and flavour, in an environmentally sustainable way, 365 days per year!

Reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Process Engineering Manager leads & executes the development of specifications and design concepts for the GoodLeaf production platform. This can encompass Seeding, Germination, Growing, Harvesting, Packaging, and Support Systems (irrigation water treatment, climate controls and LED lighting). This role works closely with internal stakeholders to design new farming systems, to improve existing processes, to develop and implement R&D initiatives and to evaluate new technologies.

In accordance with our mandatory vaccination policy, we will only interview applicants who have been fully vaccinated, or who are unable to vaccinate due to valid medical or religious reasons, and who are willing to work in-office when required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Technical ownership for segments of the GoodLeaf production platform, by becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the design and operational intent of the various farming facilities, platforms, systems, and optimization

  • Develop and deploy new farm designs based on adapting the production platform to meet operational and commercial requirements

  • Support Operations in the creation and maintenance of production operating procedures

  • Assess the value-added and appropriate use of human effort versus automation in all systems

  • Manage the approval of manufacturing drawings, inspection of equipment, and installation leading up to commissioning

  • Assist in Commission-Qualify-Verify (CQV) activities for new farm facilities and systems

  • Assist in maintaining technology and process standardization across the GoodLeaf farm network

  • Create and maintain relationships with consultants, suppliers, developers

  • Increase and develop internal knowledge with respect to vertical farming technologies (automation, climate control, irrigation, harvesting, packaging), manufacturing technologies and practices, data management/analysis

  • Actively improve technical knowledge in the controlled environment agriculture (CEA) industry

  • Lead teams of internal and external stakeholders in reviewing existing and future designs

  • Directly supervise technical teams as GoodLeaf grows

Qualifications, Education Requirements, and Preferred Skills

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Industrial, Systems, Manufacturing) is required

  • A minimum of 10 years’ experience in technical roles encompassing process design, equipment procurement and installation, with at least 4 years’ leadership experience in a technical or operational role

description:
Company Description

Bionera and its parent company, PRT Growing Services, are the leaders in establishing and managing large-scale woody biomass plantations to help solve energy, waste management and environmental issues.

We offer a range of short rotation willow crop services that are ideally suited to municipal and industrial operations, including establishment and maintenance of short-rotation willow crop plantation. Together, with our associates in the environmental consulting and irrigation industries, we can provide low-risk, turn-key solutions for disposal of municipal and industrial waste, including biosolids and wastewater.

Job Description

Reporting to the Project Coordinator, Bionera’s Crop Technician is responsible for carrying out quality assurance, monitoring and data collection activities on all aspects of plantation establishment and management. This role is suited to someone who: has an eye for detail, is a meticulous record keeper, and has an enthusiasm for improving process through results-based assessments. This position is ideal for someone with a background in science and technology and in interest in the environmental restoration industry.

The duration of this position project is expected to last approximately 5 – 6 months, May to September, schedule could be modified to accommodate a summer student. The right candidate will see opportunity for growth, career advancement and potential for ongoing employment.

Qualifications

·         Some post-secondary education in science and technology and/or direct experience in horticultural or environmental monitoring would be an asset

·         Energetic with attention to detail

·         Positive attitude, punctual, reliable and a team player

·         The ability to follow directions and work independently

·         Meticulous ability to keep neat and tidy records is a must

·         Must be physically able to work full days outdoors walking up 10 km or more daily

·         Must be prepared to work in outdoor elements

·         Appropriate attire required (raingear, sunglasses, CSA approved steel toed footwear, water)

·         Hard hat and hi-visibility vest will be provided

·         Reliable transportation to Paintearth Mine is essential

·         A valid driver’s license



Additional Information

Compensation, Benefits & Workplace Culture:

·         Competitive hourly wages, matching your level of experience and ability;

·         We provide a supportive team structured workplace, a strong safety culture, and a commitment to the environment.

description:

J0222-1929
Job Title:
Addiction Medicine Physician
Job Type:
Perm P/T
City, Province, Country:
Guelph, Ontario, Canada
Job Category:
Healthcare Professional

1

Make a difference in a growing, innovative mental health organization and centre of excellence in people-centered care. Work with supportive colleagues who are passionate about improving lives and champions for quality and continuous learning.

Position Summary

A part-time, 2 days per week opportunity is available for a physician in the Addiction Medicine Program (AMP) starting immediately. Care is delivered on-site at the Homewood Health Centre in Guelph in a collaborative manner, with a supportive interdisciplinary team which includes nursing, social work, occupational therapy, recreational therapy, horticulture therapy and consultant psychiatry.

The addiction medicine program operates 2 inpatient programs, a 6 week substance use program and a 9 week mood, anxiety, and concurrent program. Both programs integrate current evidence-based practices including routine use of opioid agonist therapy, and therapeutic modalities including motivational enhancement, CBT, DBT, occupational and recreational therapy.

In this role as Addiction Physician you will act as most responsible physician in AMP and be responsible for clinical care of patients as they engage in their recovery journey.

If you are looking for an organization that is constantly moving forward in pursuit of successful outcomes, get ready to love it here!

What you'll be doing

• Provide best practice clinical care including diagnosis and ongoing management of substance use and concurrent medical and psychiatric management and psychotherapeutic interventions
• Complete clinical documentation including history, mental status, diagnostic impression, treatment plan, and progress notes of the highest quality to ensure the medical record is meaningful and useful and a treatment plan can be established by the team
• Utilize computer medical administration such Caseworks and BDM (training provided)
• Collaborate and communicate with the inter-professional team with the shared goal of highest quality patient care
• Provide clinical direction to program development
• Participate in hospital committees/forums and quality assurance activities and attend medical staff meetings
• Provide supervision and mentorship to students and residents
• Support departmental research activities
• Provide clinical support in the training of allied Health Care Professionals
• Support colleagues with patient care coverage during physician absences, along with nurse practitioner support
• Provide legal and employment/insurance reports, as necessary
• Direct communication with referral sources, where necessary
• Complete and submit OHIP billings in a timely manner

What we're looking for

• Degree in Medicine and a license, in good standing, to practice medicine in Ontario
• Registration with CFPC and CPSO
• Certification or fellowship in Addiction Medicine, or equivalent experience, preferred
• 3 years prior physician experience in a similar role, preferred
• Experience working collaboratively within an inter-disciplinary team
• Commitment to infection prevention and control needs of the hospital
• Exceptional leadership skills
• Proven critical thinking and analysis skills
• Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and action-oriented
• Strong ability to create exceptional relationship with referrers
• Excellent verbal and written English communication skills, French would be an asset
• Highly developed organizational and time-management skills
• Proficiency with Microsoft Office
• Inspire others to be accountable through action, decisions and/or communications
• Catalyst to help the organization contribute to the community
• Commitment to working within Homewood’s Health and Safety Standards

Why work with us

Homewood Health is Canada’s largest and leading service provider for medically focused, evidence-based treatment of mental health and addiction disorders. Our organizational culture values service excellence, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Our people make a difference!

As an equal opportunity employer, Homewood Health is committed to employment accessibility, diversity, equity and inclusion. For this reason, we encourage applications from members of equity-seeking groups including women, racialized and indigenous communities, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities/expressions.

Homewood Health Inc. is committed to ensuring that its teams reflect the diversity of our community and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. In accordance with the various provincial legislations that we operate under, Homewood Health is committed to working in collaboration with any team member who may require workplace accommodation in order to successfully perform any or all aspects of their role.

Join us at Homewood Health™ and be part of a diverse team helping Canadians live healthier, more productive and fulfilling lives.

title: Junior Certified Arborist
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Our Waterloo office is looking to fill an Arborist / Field Technician position in our growing Canadian Operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Carrying out accurate and complete tree inventories in support of a range of projects according to applicable guidelines, by-laws, and best management practices (BMPs);
  • Assisting with the preparation of Arborist Reports, Tree Protection and Preservation Plans, and Restoration/Compensation Tree Planting Plans;
  • Providing accurate and complete field notes;
  • Data entry and data management;
  • Working with CAD and/or GIS teams to produce figures;
  • Collect point and topographic survey data to support tree inventory and arborist activities;
  • Providing field and office support to other members of the group as required (e.g., botanical inventories, Ecological Land Classification, amphibian calling surveys, benthic surveys, erosion and sediment control inspections, water quality sampling and flow measurements, sanitary and storm sewer monitoring, statistical analyses, data entry and table preparation, etc.);
  • Providing support to other groups or initiatives as required (e.g., construction oversite);
  • Travel (generally within the province) will be required – an estimated 70% of time will be out of the office (dependent on project and seasonal requirements);
  • Handling and disposing of samples and sampling equipment weighing up to 50 lbs;

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 0-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in a consulting environment;
  • Degree, Diploma or Certificate in Ecology, Biology, Forestry, Horticulture, Landscape Architecture, Arboriculture or related fields an asset;
  • Credentials as an International Society of Arboriculture (ISA) Certified Arborist or ability to acquire ISA certification within 3 months of employment;
  • Strong vegetation identification skills
  • ISA Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ) an asset
  • Canadian Inspector of Sediment and Erosion and Control (CISEC) certification an asset;
  • Experience completing Site surveys using traditional survey methods and real-time kinematic (RTK) global positioning system (GPS) units
  • Detail-oriented, ability to provide accurate field and data records;
  • Familiar and proficient with electronic data collection;
  • Ability to read and understand engineering drawings/plans;
  • Ability to exercise good judgment;
  • Self-motivated and able to balance multiple tasks;
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Great teammate, collaborative with other staff;
  • Ability to meet challenging deadlines;
  • Comfortable working for extended durations throughout all seasons and during inclement/adverse weather conditions;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; and
  • Must own a reliable vehicle and hold a valid driver’s license;

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process..
